prompts.Prompt: Who is the client and what is the project scope.

PromptDesc.desc: ð—¡ð—¼ð˜ð—²: As an example to demonstrate the prompts, we have uploaded a few files in promptx, and the prompts below are related to those files.

Code.code:
"Client and Project Scope
Client: The client appears to be a government tax authority or a related organization responsible for managing and processing tax submissions.
Project Scope: The project aims to transition from the existing paper-based tax forms under Section 9b to a new digitized form for Section 9b by January 1, 2025. The key requirements include:
   1.	Ensuring no data loss for existing cases under Â§ 9b.
   2.	Allowing tax officers to view all necessary case data for processing old cases in 
   the new digitized system or via a PDF if not possible in the new dialogs.
   3.	Ensuring all cases not completed at the time of changeover can be completed 
   post-changeover.
   Bold Steps (High Level)
   If there is still time in session 1, the bold steps to mention at a high level are:
   1.	Kickoff: An expert explains the content of a design concept to the Business 
   Analysts (BAs) who will write the specification.
   2.	White Paper Session (WPS): BAs explain to Functional Analysts (FA), Technical 
   Analysts (TA), Testers, and the Design Concept author the rough ideas for the 
   specification.
   3.	Writing Specification: The specification must be correct, complete, and 
   understandable.
   4.	Correct Word User: Ensure the correct Word user is used.
   5.	Open Real Spec Artefacts: Explain the structure and core content of different 
   artefact types like Dialogs, Services, and Confluence screens.
   Detailed Discussion in Session 2
   In session 2, the bold steps should be discussed in detail, including:
   1.	General Idea of the Specification: Overview of what the specification aims to 
   achieve.
   2.	Specifics of the Package: Detailed explanation of the package's specifics.
   3.	Planned Data Model Changes: Any changes to the data model.
   4.	Artefacts Creation/Adjustment: Which artefacts will be created or adjusted.
   5.	Design Decisions: Key design decisions taken.
   6.	Open Points to be Clarified: Any unresolved issues that need clarification.
   7.	Time Schedule: Timeline for completing the specification.
   By following this structured approach, the project aims to ensure a smooth 
   transition to the new digitized tax form system while maintaining data integrity 
   and usability for tax officers."

Code.code:
"Based on the provided document summary, here is a list of use cases for the digitized portal for tax submission under the energy or electricity tax act:
Use Cases
1.	UC01: User Login
    o	Description: Tax Payer logs into the online portal.
    o	Actors: Tax Payer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Payer has valid login credentials.
    o	Postconditions: Tax Payer is authenticated and redirected to the main 
        dashboard.
2.	UC02: View and Fill Tax Application Form
    o	Description: Tax Payer views and fills out the tax application form.
    o	Actors: Tax Payer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Payer is logged into the portal.
    o	Postconditions: Tax Payer completes the form with all required information.
3.	UC03: Enter Tax Payer Information
    o	Description: Tax Payer enters personal and business details.
    o	Actors: Tax Payer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Payer is filling out the tax application form.
    o	Postconditions: Tax Payer information is saved in the system.
4.	UC04: Enter Basic Data
    o	Description: Tax Payer enters basic data about the application, including the 
        period and tax components.
    o	Actors: Tax Payer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Payer is filling out the tax application form.
    o	Postconditions: Basic data is saved in the system.
5.	UC05: Enter Economic Activities
    o	Description: Tax Payer provides details of their business activities.
    o	Actors: Tax Payer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Payer is filling out the tax application form.
    o	Postconditions: Economic activity details are saved in the system.
6.	UC06: Enter Tax Details
    o	Description: Tax Payer enters details about the quantity of electricity products 
        used and applicable tax rates.
    o	Actors: Tax Payer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Payer is filling out the tax application form.
    o	Postconditions: Tax details are saved in the system.
7.	UC07: Review Summary
    o	Description: Tax Payer reviews the total calculation summary of the tax 
        application.
    o	Actors: Tax Payer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Payer has entered all required information.
    o	Postconditions: Tax Payer confirms the summary.
8.	UC08: Submit Tax Application
    o	Description: Tax Payer submits the completed tax application form.
    o	Actors: Tax Payer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Payer has reviewed and confirmed the summary.
    o	Postconditions: Tax application is submitted to the system for processing.
9.	UC09: Verify Tax Application
    o	Description: Tax Officer verifies the submitted tax application details.
    o	Actors: Tax Officer

    o	Postconditions: Tax Officer verifies the details and updates the status of the 
        application.
10.	UC10: View Historical Data
    o	Description: Tax Officer views historical data of tax applications.
    o	Actors: Tax Officer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Officer is logged into the system.
    o	Postconditions: Historical data is displayed, either in the new interface or as a 
        PDF.
11.	UC11: Complete Processing of Application
    o	Description: Tax Officer completes the processing of the tax application.
    o	Actors: Tax Officer
    o	Preconditions: Tax Officer has verified all details.
    o	Postconditions: Application status is updated to complete.
12.	UC12: Handle Incomplete Cases During Changeover
    o	Description: Ensure incomplete cases at the time of changeover can be 
        completed post-changeover.
    o	Actors: Tax Officer, System
    o	Preconditions: Changeover to the new system is in progress.
    o	Postconditions: Incomplete cases are migrated and can be processed in the new 
        system.
        Key Stakeholders
    â€¢	Tax Payer
    â€¢	Tax Officer
        Project Scope
    â€¢	Transition from paper forms to a digitized system for tax applications under 
        Section 9b.
    â€¢	Ensure data on existing cases is not lost.

    â€¢	Ensure all incomplete cases at the time of changeover can be completed post- 
        changeover.

    â€¢	Software adjustments for new laws outside of Section 9b.
    â€¢	Further migrations and design concepts not related to the switch from the old 
        form to the new form for Section 9b.
        System Context
    â€¢	Consider system context before and after the changeover.
    â€¢	Ensure no data loss, incorrect orders, or duplications during the transition.
        This list of use cases should cover the main functionalities and processes 
        described in the document summary.
"

prompts.Prompt: For use case 1 generate list of user stories with detailed acceptance criteria, Pre-conditions and Post-conditions.

PromptDesc.desc: ð—¡ð—¼ð˜ð—²: As an example to demonstrate the prompts, we have uploaded a few files in promptx, and the prompts below are related to those files.

Code.code:
"Based on the provided document summary, here are the user stories with detailed acceptance criteria, pre-conditions, and post-conditions for the use case of digitizing the paper form for tax submission by a taxpayer:
User Story 1: Taxpayer Information Input
    â€¢	As a taxpayer, I want to input my personal and bank account details into the 
       online tax portal so that I can submit my tax declaration digitally.
       Acceptance Criteria:
    o	The portal must have fields for Name, Address (Street, State, Country, PIN code), 
        and Bank account details.
    o	The information must be securely saved and retrievable for future submissions.
    o	The system must validate the input data for format and completeness.
        Pre-conditions:
    o	The taxpayer must have an account on the digitized portal.
    o	The taxpayer must be logged in to access the form.
        Post-conditions:
    o	The taxpayer's information is stored in the system for the current and future tax 
        declarations.
    User Story 2: Basic Data Input
     â€¢	As a taxpayer, I want to provide basic data about my tax application so that the 
        correct period and tax components are recorded.
        Acceptance Criteria:
    o	The portal must include fields for the period (month, year) and tax components.
    o	The system must ensure that the data entered corresponds to the correct tax 
        period.
    Pre-conditions:
    o	The taxpayer has successfully entered their personal information.
    Post-conditions:
    o	The basic data is associated with the taxpayer's current declaration.
    User Story 3: Economic Activities Detailing
    â€¢	As a taxpayer, I want to detail my economic activities to ensure my tax 
    declaration reflects my business accurately.
    Acceptance Criteria:
    o	The portal must provide a section for detailing the taxpayer's business activities.
    o	The system must link the economic activities to the correct tax clauses.
    Pre-conditions:
    o	The taxpayer has completed the previous sections of the form.
    Post-conditions:
    o	The economic activities are recorded and will be used for tax calculation.
    User Story 4: Tax Details Specification
    â€¢	As a taxpayer, I want to specify the quantity of electricity products used and the 
    tax rate so that my tax due can be accurately calculated.
    Acceptance Criteria:
    o	The portal must have fields for entering the quantity of electricity used and the 
    applicable tax rate.
    o	The system must calculate the tax based on the inputs and display the amount 
    to the taxpayer.
    Pre-conditions:
    o	The taxpayer has provided their economic activities details.
   Post-conditions:
   o	The tax details are saved and used for the summary calculation.
   User Story 5: Tax Declaration Summary and Submission
    â€¢	As a taxpayer, I want to review a summary of my tax declaration and submit it to 
    the main customs office.
    Acceptance Criteria:
    o	The portal must display a summary of all the information entered by the 
    taxpayer.
    o	The system must include a disclaimer and a submit button.
    o	Upon submission, the system must send a confirmation to the taxpayer and 
    notify the tax officer.
    Pre-conditions:
    o	All previous sections of the tax declaration form must be completed.
    Post-conditions:
    o	The tax declaration is submitted to the system and is pending review by a tax 
    officer.
    User Story 6: Tax Officer Review and Processing
    â€¢	As a tax officer, I want to review the details of the tax declaration submitted by 
    the taxpayer and complete the processing of the application.
    Acceptance Criteria:
    o	The system must allow tax officers to access and review the submitted tax 
    declarations.
    o	The system must provide access to previous records and master data of the 
    taxpayer.
    o	The tax officer must be able to complete the processing of the application 
    within the system.
    Pre-conditions:
    o	The taxpayer has submitted their tax declaration.
    Post-conditions:
    o	The tax declaration is either approved, and the process is completed, or further 
        action is required from the taxpayer.
        These user stories cover the digitization of the tax declaration submission 
        process, ensuring a smooth transition from paper-based to digital forms while 
        maintaining data integrity and providing a user-friendly interface for both 
        taxpayers and tax officers.
"

prompts.Prompt: What are the primary goals of this project?

PromptDesc.desc: ð—¡ð—¼ð˜ð—²: As an example to demonstrate the prompts, we have uploaded a few files in promptx, and the prompts below are related to those files.

Code.code:
"The primary goals of this project, as derived from the provided document summary, are:
1.	Digital Transformation of Tax Administration:
    o	Reimagine and digitize the processes necessary to calculate and pay taxes.
    o	Integrate tax administration securely into the tools and processes of the digital 
        economy, including cross-border transactions.
2.	Simplification and Reduction of Burdens:
    o	Make taxation simpler and less burdensome for taxpayers.
    o	Ensure that the right amount of tax is paid through efficient digital processes.
3.	Digitization of Manual Processes:
    o	Specifically, digitize the manual process of declaring electricity tax by submitting 
        a tax declaration on an officially prescribed form to the main customs office.
    o	Allow tax debtors to apply for tax relief digitally if a tax exemption has been 
       granted.
4.	Development of a Digitized Portal:
    o	Start with digitizing the paper form (form no 9b) for tax declaration submission 
        online.
    o	Sort tax artefacts into different categories in a hierarchy based on their business 
        type and specific clauses in the energy or electricity tax act.
5.	User Interface Design and Implementation:
    o	Design a user-friendly interface for companies to enter tax applications 
        regarding electricity tax.
    o	Include various panels such as Tax Payer Information, Tax Relief Overview, and 
        others for a comprehensive digital experience.
6.	Logging and Tracking Changes:
    o	Implement a service function to log entries for value changes in the tax relief 
        application process.
    o	Ensure that any changes in data fields are tracked and logged with old and new 
        values for transparency and auditing purposes.
        These goals aim to modernize the tax administration process, making it more 
        efficient, user-friendly, and integrated with modern digital tools.
"
